intro: Strychnos bahiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian strychnos, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
